How_Calculated: Age-specific number of residents diagnosed with lung or bronchus cancer over the 5 year period; divided by the corresponding age-specific intercensal population estimates (from NYS DOH). The resulting age-specific rates are multiplied by the proportion of the US Census 2000 standard population in each age group. Age-adjusted rate is the sum of these weighted rates; expressed as cases per 100;000 residents.

indicator_id: NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
